schema.name: Cafe France Bacon Potato Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and dice the potatoes into bite-sized pieces.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and add the diced potatoes. Cook until tender, about 15 minutes.
While the potatoes are cooking, dice the carrots and cut the lean rasher into small pieces.
In a pan over medium heat, cook the lean rasher pieces until crispy, about 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, mix the cooked potatoes, crispy lean rasher, diced carrots, and chopped green leaf lettuce.
Season with salt and ground pepper to taste.
Add 2 tablespoons of mayo to the salad and gently toss to combine.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthier version of everyone's favorite side dish with this Café France Bacon Potato Salad. Crafted with the finest ingredients and tailored for a low-sugar diet, this recipe brings together the crispness of green leaf lettuce, the heartiness of potatoes, and the savory delight of lean bacon. A touch of mayo ties it all together into a dish that's perfect for those seeking health-conscious recipes without sacrificing flavor.
